intro: Senecio cylindrocephalus, commonly known as the cylindrical-headed senecio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its cylindrical flower head is a distinctive feature, composed of numerous small yellow flowers arranged in a tight cluster. Senecio cylindrocephalus is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and hardy nature.
